respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)
respStmt.name: Matthew Holford

msItem.title: Fuero Juzgo
msItem.note: The Castilian version of the Visigothic Liber Judiciorum, as pr. in the edition of the Real Academia Espanola, Madrid, 1815, except that in Book XII, between tits. 1 and 2 (fols. 117v-118v) are thirteen canons on the Jews:

msItem.incipit: Esta ley diz que el primer canon da dignitdat

msItem.note: There are marginal glosses for each law in the hand of the text.

msItem.author: Jacobo de las Leyes
msItem.title: Flores de derecho dotrinal
msItem.rubric: Aqui comiencan las somas de maestre Iacob de las leys
msItem.incipit: Al mucho ondrado sennor Don Alfonso Fernandez
msItem.explicit: Senyor Io pensse en las parablas
msItem.incipit: Sennor conviene que quando ovierdes oyr los pleytos
msItem.note: (as pr. in his Obras, ed. R. de Urena y Smenjaud and A. Bonilla y San Martin (Madrid, 1924), pp. 11-184).

msItem.title: Fuero of Leon, 1058
msItem.rubric: Aqui comienca el fuero de la cibdat de Leon et de sus terminos
msItem.note: (pr. Munoz y Romero, Colleccion de los Fueros Municipals (Madrid, 1847), pp. 60 seqq.).

msItem.title: Council of Coyansa
msItem.note: (Spanish text; the Latin is pr. by Mansi, Concilia, XIX, 785-790.
msItem.rubric: Estos son los degrados estableciados del tienpo del rey Don Ffernando de Leon y de la reyna Dona Sancha y de todos los obispos de Espannia y de los arcobispos de su regno. Sub era MLXXXVIIII[1050 A.D.]

layoutDesc.layout: 35 written lines of main text; approx 3 lines of gloss to 2 lines of main text; in 2, plus 1 or 2 columns of gloss column(s).

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces left blank for nitials at bginnings of books, smaller initials blue with red and red with blue penwork. In the lists of capitula titles of books are enclosed in circles of blue and red.

binding.p: Typical Holkham binding of polished brown leather; the spine lettered in gilt 'DE LOS | ENSINAMENTOS | DE LAS LEES || M.S. | ESPAGNOL'; joints repaired.

history.provenance: 17th century: inscibed 'Liber hic est forus iud. secundum ... []lationis Wotaldi (?) ... Ser Etoro qu[...]', mostly erased.
Don Luis Varona Lapata (?), 17th century: inscribed (but almost totally erased) 'Es de don Luis Varona Lapata (?)'
Signed by 'T. Coke' (fol. 1r, lower margin); bookplate of 'THOMAS WILLIAM COKE'; formerly Norfolk, Holkham Hall, MS. 718.

recordHist.source: Draft description by Peter Kidd, late 1990s
